title: SIToBI - A Speech Prosody Annotation Tool for Indian Languages
author: Preethi Thinakaran (Shiv Nadar University Chennai), Malarvizhi Muthuramalingam (Shiv Nadar University Chennai), Sooriya S (Shiv Nadar University Chennai), Anushiya Rachel Gladston (Indian Institute of Technology Madras), P. Vijayalakshmi (Sri Sivasubramaniya Nadar College of Engineering), Hema A Murthy (Indian Institute of Technology Madras), T. Nagarajan (Indian Institute of Technology Madras)
relevance_why: This work could help improve text-to-speech systems through enhanced prosodic modeling by integrating the SIToBI tool, which automates prosodic annotations, into existing speech synthesis frameworks.
background: The tool provides automated prosodic annotations for Indian languages, facilitating more natural speech synthesis and recognition tasks.
contribution: The paper introduces the SIToBI tool to solve the challenge of deriving accurate prosodic annotations for Indian languages, achieving high accuracy in prosodic labeling and segmentation.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing tools for prosody annotation predominantly focus on English, often lacking standardization for Indian languages and requiring significant manual intervention.
technical_comparison.novelty: SIToBI extends existing frameworks by providing automated annotation capabilities specifically tailored for Tamil, Hindi, and Indian English while being adaptable for other Indian languages.

key_innovation: The tool integrates time-aligned phonetic, syllabic, and word transcriptions with prosodic features, enabling a comprehensive analysis of speech signals.
real_world_impact: The SIToBI tool enhances human-computer interactions across Indian languages by improving the naturalness of synthesized speech and aiding in more effective speech processing applications.
limitations: Some inaccuracies in automatic speech recognition may lead to errors in the prosodic labeling.

new_terms.prosody: **Prosody** refers to the rhythm, stress, and intonation of speech, which conveys meaning beyond the individual words.
new_terms.Segmentation with Intensity, Tones and B: SIToBI is a tool for automatic prosody labeling, extending the ToBI framework to accommodate Indian languages with syllable-timed characteristics.
new_terms.Tones and Break Indices (ToBI): **ToBI** is a standardized system for prosody transcription developed for the English language.
